title: Apple Built Its Empire With China. Now Its Foundation Is Showing Cracks.
description: Lawmakers’ objections to an obscure Chinese semiconductor company and tough Covid-19 restrictions are hurting Apple’s ability to make new iPhones in China.

title: Greece to Ban Sale of Spyware After Government Is Accused of Surveillance
description: Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis announced the ban after a news report claimed that he had directed the use of spyware against prominent politicians and journalists, which he denied.

title: Elon Musk Is Tweeting Through a Tide of Criticism
description: The new owner of Twitter has embarked on a tweeting spree to push back, spar and justify his actions.

title: Biggest Surge of Misinformation May Arrive After Election Day, Researchers Say
description: People who study disinformation are warning that far-right influencers will seize on ballot-counting delays and other routine issues as evidence of fraud.

title: What Is Mastodon and Why Are People Leaving Twitter for It?
description: Since Elon Musk took ownership of Twitter, some of its users have migrated to Mastodon, an alternative social platform.

title: CUNY Graduates With Tech Degrees Struggle to Land Tech Jobs
description: Students at the City University of New York are increasingly graduating with degrees in technology. A new report details the obstacles they face in landing jobs.

title: Apple Could Be Short of iPhones Because of Factory Disruptions in China
description: The company said Covid-19 restrictions were slowing production of the company’s new phones ahead of the holiday season.
